Stayed with kids
review_text:
Very cute home.
The note about the train from the host is misleading. Itâ€™s true the train is within a mile, but itâ€™s actually about 3 houses away, and you can see the train and its intersection from the front window. We woke up at 12:30AM to the sound of the train blowing itâ€™s horn and traveling through. It was very loud and disturbing. Iâ€™m disappointed because the hostsâ€™s note mentions that you wouldnâ€™t be disrupted if inside, and it would travel during business business hours.
From the host:
â€œPlease note - house is within 1 mile of rail road tracks. Train travels by max 2 times during business hours. This is not disruptive if inside.â€
I came to this house to have a good nights rest (one night stay) and was very disappointed. I am shocked no other reviews mention this, so felt the need to let others know.
Otherwise the host communicated great, and the house is thoughtfully decorated with fun extras like the electronic game table. Because of the train, I would not stay here again.

name: Sarah & Mike
rating_info:
Rating, 2 stars
,
Â·
April 2022
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
The location is a quick drive to Delano and Old Town, and is in a relatively quiet neighborhood. Itâ€™s conveniently located near a large grocery store, and the Twin Lakes shopping area is nearby. The house has a great open floor plan for the living room, dining room, and kitchen, with lots of opportunity for natural light. The fenced backyard has a great deck area with a propane fire pit and ample seating areas. The house has a pleasing style mixed between a simple and elegant modern aesthetic, and mid-century modern flair. The house was well stocked with pots and pans, condiments, blankets, etc. Our only issues were some cleanliness issues and how they were addressed.
We arrived around midnight of the day of our scheduled check-in, having driven all day from our point of origin. We quickly put the children (a four-year old girl and five-year old girl) to bed, then went to bed ourselves. After getting up in the morning, we noticed feces smeared on the outside of the toilet bowl, near where the convex part of the bowl meets the vertical base of the toilet. We noted a few more cleanliness issues (hair, hair bands, and contacts in the bathroom, dead flies on a window sill, crumbs in the fridge, and a pile of food sitting in the back corner of the cabinet the trash can sits in). We had paid an above-average price for this Airbnb to avoid these sorts of issues, so we sent a message to the host to address it. In the meantime, we cleaned up most of these areas, as we had small children in the house, and we didnâ€™t want them using a toilet with feces on the outside of it.
The host responded promptly, offered financial compensation, and to send out a cleaner to take care of the issues. The host attributed the cleanliness issues to using a cleaner that they usually donâ€™t use. We declined the cleaning visit, as we already took care of most of the cleanliness issues, and we were focused on quality time with family (two of the guests in our group had flown in from overseas, and had not visited with family in the U.S. in five years).
The host wrote later that afternoon to us again. She attempted to send a video from the cleaner which would not load for us, that was purported to show a clean toilet, and asked if one of the children may have caused the feces on the outside of the bowl. The host claimed the refrigerator might have had frost built up and that what we thought were crumbs were not crumbs.
The host then stated that they did a walk through of the house after it was cleaned, which was not mentioned earlier in the message traffic. Then they said, â€œItâ€™s just a tad bit suspicious that yâ€™all wouldnâ€™t let us come and make it right. At this point, I hope there havenâ€™t been false accusations in hopes of getting your longer stay comped.â€
We found that statement incredibly offensive and unprofessional for someone serving customers in the hospitality industry. We were spending the day with family, which included the first time an uncle had the opportunity to meet his five-year old niece who lives overseas. We preferred not to have a person in the house with us, cleaning, while we were trying to have family time.
Then the host said, â€œAlso, we have cameras up outside for the safety of our guests and noticed yâ€™all leaving the door open on many occasions for many minutes. Please be mindful of that. Thatâ€™s how flyâ€™s and bugs enter.â€ This seemed a bit petty, as a way to mention that we were being observed. And yes, we did leave the door open on a spring day when the temperature was pleasant and in the 70s.
After receiving the comments about us being suspicious and making false accusations, and that we were being watched on the security camera, we decided we had no interest in the hostâ€™s compensation offer, or continuing to support this host by staying in this house any longer than we had to. We communicated directly with Airbnb, arranged alternate lodging through Airbnb, and checked out of this house. We were refunded for the remaining days that we did not end up staying, and partially compensated for the stay where we had the cleanliness issues.
Ultimately, we were willing to resolve the cleanliness issues with the host â€“ up until the point we felt personally offended by the hostâ€™s conduct.

review_text: Oh gosh, what can I say about our stay at Tracey's lovely home? She was so helpful during while booking, and continued to reach out to welcome us prior to arrival. We met with some out-of-town family, and the goal was simply to spend time together; we did just that. Tracey's home was cozy and well-stocked with everything we needed to cook every meal, the living room set-up was excellent when our toddler wanted to play with all five grown-ups, and we didn't feel crowded at all! There are several streaming options if you want to simply veg or have something on in the background, but if you want to explore the outdoors, the yard is a great place to do so. There is a FABULOUS stray cat that sometimes visits and for some on our trip, that was the highlight, haha. The bedrooms and bathrooms were clean and decorated beautifully, and the hot tub was GREAT! Don't wait, book NOW!

d a perfect escape from the hustle and bustle of everyday life. The comfortable beds ensured a restful sleep, and the cozy house exuded warmth and charm.

review_text:
My family stayed in this home which was 7 of us. The host, Tracey, was amazing to work with!! Tracey communicated very quickly from the time we started looking at this airbnb. i sent Tracey messages from before we booked, during our stay, and when we left and she always responded promptly! This was truly a home and had absolutely everything you could possibly need from the kitchen, to games and entertainment, first aid, fans, grill, hot tub , extra blankets, pillows, washer/dryer, any condiment imaginable or spice needed, dishes and any cooking appliance you can think of. i have never been to a better equipped airbnb.
All of it was amazing, but the chemical free cleaning and norwex products used was refreshing to find and made us feel very safe. My family has lots of allergies and trouble staying at hotels with different cleaners and down type pillows . Literally every cleaner, soap, towels , and fresheners used were chemical free. This airbnb is somewhere you can know you will be safe from viruses and any chemicals that would typically bother you in a hotel.
The host was extremely accommodating and we got to visit with Tracey and her husband. They are great people ! We canâ€™t wait to stay here again!!

name: Joshua

,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
I've had many excellent airbnb stays, and this one stands out as among the best of them.  Tracey's house is a clean, quiet, relatively secluded gem located in an older (~1940's-1950's?) low-density neighborhood in the extreme northern end of Wichita. Very close to I-135. The kitchen contained everything I needed to prepare my own food. On site laundry equipment with supplies. Everything I needed for a weeks-long stay was there. Communication with Tracey was easy, prompt, and never intrusive.
One major positive detail: With some of my past airbnb stays, descriptions & photos led to expections very different from what I arrived to find. But Tracey's house exceeded my expectations. Yes, her photos & description are accurate. But the potential disappointments I've learned to look out for never happened. No bad smells. No loud neighbors or road noises. The neighborhood is not sketchy. This is a detached house all to yourself. Lots of off-street parking.
Tracey is was a wonderful host. I very much look forward to future stays in her home.

review_text: We had a family of 10 stay at Alexâ€™s place for a weekend wedding so it was a full house. The house is exactly as it looks in the pictures and very beautiful. I love that it was close to stores and in a very accessible area with many places nearby Target was just about 5 minutes away and there was a playground that was perfect for my son not too far either. Getting on to the highway to get into downtown Wichita was so easy and a straight shot. The neighborhood is quiet and the neighbors that did see us were very nice and kind. Alexâ€™s place was equipped with everything we needed in the bedroom, bathroom, kitchen, and laundry. It really is a home away from home. A nice plus is that there were also toys for my son who easily gets bored of his toys, we ended up only packing one toy for him but the toddler toys and the little kitchen really kept my son occupied while I could get ready for the wedding. The decor is absolutely beautiful too! We drove from Illinois and got into town earlier than expected and Alex was very kind enough to accommodate us checking in sooner than expected- after a long day of driving , that was a little gesture that made a huge impact for us! It made such a difference in our rest since we had to get ready to go to a dinner 3 hours after we got into town! Alex is very responsive whenever we needed anything. I canâ€™t say enough, THANK YOU Alex! We would definitely stay here again over and over again whenever in Kansas!

review_text: THAT was a great experience! We went to Wichita for a Chris Stapleton concert and weâ€™re very lucky to find this place. The neighborhood is a great location. Parking was easy. The unit is 3 blocks from the arena. So, we grabbed dinner from the BBQ restaurant downstairs and ate in the unit. Placed foosball, shuffleboard, and darts in the unit for fun. Walked to the arena through a downtown square and park that has recently been remodeled. Beautiful area. Enjoyed the concert. Walked back at midnight and felt totally safe. Grabbed a beer at the brewery across the street for a minute and then slept in a comfortable bed. The next morning walked back through the square to a highly rated brunch place and had a great time. This place helped us enjoy a great experience in Wichita.

review_text: Laura and Aaron are great! This is a beautiful home with more beautiful hosts! This was our first time experiencing Airbnb, and they made it feel like home. They were very good at respecting boundaries but opening their house at the same time. We weren't really at the house too much during the day because we were exploring all that Wichita has to offer. When we were there, they enjoyed listening to what we did that day and giving us recommendations for the next day. I enjoyed reading the guest book that was in the room. Aaron is a musician, so there are guitars everywhere. Some guests have enjoyed listening to his music. I was looking forward to hearing him sing, but unfortunately, we had to cut our trip short to explore more of Kansas. Overall, I'd give them a 10/10 and highly recommend them. Thank you, Laura and Aaron!

Stayed with a pet
review_text:
Get over any misconceptions you might have about staying in an RV park. Everyone we ran into & chatted with were friendly & absolutely lovely.
Timâ€™s tiny home is adorable and spotless. It had everything we needed for a long weekend visiting family.
Plenty of towels, pillows, and blankets. Cleaning supplies are available. Tiny house, huge shower. The bathroom is surprisingly spacious and spotless. The coffee maker is a Keurig, so if you travel with your preferred blend, pack pods.
We have 3 small, blind, elderly dogs. The tiny house was a perfect size for them - they were always in sight & they didnâ€™t have to navigate multiple rooms or stairs. Thereâ€™s even a ramp from the porch to the driveway!
The RV park is close to the highway & convenient for getting anywhere in the area.
There are several small restaurants nearby. We recommend the Thai place just across 31st street.
Pro tip: leave the ceiling fan on in the winter. It circulates the warm air from the mini split.

Their back yard is like a secret garden, with a wonderful deck. Jerry even printed and wrote out special instructions for me to get around some of the construction areas! If you want to visit, Dottie and Jerry will be there. If not, they are perfectly fine with that as well. Their place is very easy to access. I truly enjoyed my stay.

If you have any seconds thoughts about staying here, I'm telling you this is the right, and only place to stay in Wichita. Jerry and Dottie are amazing people, full of stories and knowledge of the Wichita area for first time visitors. Dottie took the time to bake delicious sweets, and the spot was stocked up with nearly everything I needed for an entire trip.
It's located in a very nice part of town, and is quiet with an amazing backyard that they are kind enough to share with travelers. Shops are very close, and easily accessible for anything you need.
The hosts are more than welcoming to spend hours chatting and having a drink, offering locations to visit. At the same time, they are aware of your time, and courteous to let you focus on your trip.
There's a reason this spot has 5 star ratings up and down. This was without a doubt, my favorite place to stay, and if the hosts had an Airbnb in every town, I'd never choose another place. Thanks Jerry and Dottie!

name: Vonnie
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
October 2017
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: My mother celebrated her 100th birthday on October 2nd and Dottie and Jerry went so far beyond my wildest dreams of making her birthday memorable that it was way beyond my comprehension. The amenities were wonderful, the homemade treats were heavenly, the peaceful atmosphere so perfect for her. I went grocery shopping before I picked her up and was amazed to see everything that was already there for us. I wish I had looked there first but on the other hand that would have been unfair of me if I took advantage of their generosity. The only thing that I didn't find that I could have used was a needle!! The apartment was easy for her to get around, and both Jerry and Dottie went out of their way to make sure she was comfortable and were right there to help me. They made sure that I went in first to make certain that it would be the right place for her. The garden, complete with pond and beautiful waterfall, is gorgeous. Mom told me to make sure they know that she will be back on her 200th birthday! They brought her a pretty cupcake with lighted candle, a card, and sang Happy Birthday to her. Her smile was wonderful to see. I am SO GLAD that their place was the one that I chose for my first experience with Airbnb. I highly recommend their place for anyone looking for the perfect place in Wichita.

review_text: Dorothy was a wonderful host and so was her husband. She bakes wonderful homemade goodies. They literally think of everything you could need. There is a TV in the kitchen. It was a wonderful relaxing weekend for my husband and myself. It was much needed for us as being dual military. The communication between was wonderful. They are a great couple and we really do look forward to coming back again.

review_text: We spent two nights with Dottie and Jerry and enjoyed an exceptionally wonderful stay. The apartment is beautiful, comfortable, and restful. They went above and beyond anything we could have asked for in anticipating and providing for any and every need we could have had. Homemade cookies and muffins, a stocked refrigerator, and pre-measured coffee packs for the perfect cup o' java are only the beginning of a long list of amenities. They even helped me with our luggage and medical equipment, something I certainly didn't expect! We travel to Wichita occasionally to visit family and friends, and we hope we will always be able to stay with Dottie and Jerry. We only wish we had had a more relaxed schedule so we could have enjoyed more getaway time in the garden. I hope they won't change a thing...it's perfect!

review_text: PACK LIGHTER, STAY LONGER. That is what I'll do next time I stay at Dorothy's. There is no need to go out for breakfast as everything you need is right here, from fresh milk and cereal to fruit and yummy home-baked muffins. And plenty of coffee! There's a body wash/shampoo/conditioner dispenser in the shower, fan in the bedroom, extra pillows and blankets, and soft bath towels. The bedroom is dark and quiet...something you will not find at most hotels. Jerry has done an amazing job with the lush, private oasis outside the entrance. Plan to linger in this courtyard. This place far exceed my expectations. Dorothy and Jerry were warm and friendly hosts. This place is a gift and blessing. I definitely want to return, with my husband next time, but will need to plan ahead, as the word is getting out about this lovely place!
